      • makeSSHTunnelDBConnection

        public boolean makeSSHTunnelDBConnection(java.lang.String DBName,
                                         java.lang.String DBHost,
                                         java.lang.String sshHost)
        This method demonstrates makeSSHTunnelDBConnection(). This method allows you to give the DBName and Server name to connect to. This method still uses the same
        server to create the port forwarding.
        Makes a DB connection to a local DB instance.
        sTestMySQLConnector.serverName
        sTestMySQLConnector.username
        sTestMySQLConnector.password
        Parameters:
        DBName - - Name of the DB to connect to
        DBHost - - ServerName to connect to
        sshHost - - ssh server
        Returns:
        boolean - true if connection was made, false otherwise

      • makeSSHTunnelDBConnection

        public boolean makeSSHTunnelDBConnection(java.lang.String DBName)
        This method demonstrates makeSSHTunnelDBConnection(). This method allows you to give the DBName where the DBHost,and SSHHost are pulled from the properties file
        server to create the port forwarding.
        Makes a DB connection to a local DB instance.
        sTestMySQLConnector.serverName
        sTestMySQLConnector.username
        sTestMySQLConnector.password
        Parameters:
        DBName - - Name of the DB to connect to
        Returns:
        boolean - true of connection was made, false otherwise

        public void closeConnections()

      • selfTest

        public java.sql.ResultSet selfTest(boolean tunnelConnection)
        This method demonstrates selfTest(). use this to test local and SSH DB connections
        Parameters:
        tunnelConnection - - true if you want to test SSH connection, false otherwise to test local connection
        Returns:
        ResultSet - Results of the query
